summary: This bill, the Public Health Funding Restoration Act, aims to fully fund the Prevention and Public Health Fund to $2 billion annually, starting in fiscal year 2026. It highlights the importance of prevention programs in the United States healthcare system, citing their effectiveness in reducing healthcare costs, preventing diseases, and supporting public health initiatives at the state, local, tribal, and territorial levels. The bill argues that restoring funding will allow for more evidence-based programs and better preparedness for future public health threats.
